sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Independency accused by nine severall arguments: written by a godly learned minister, to a member of Mr. John Goodwins congregation, and acquitted by severall replyes to the said arguments by a member of the same church. In both which, sweetnesse of spirit, and soundnesse of arguments have been endeavoured. Published according to order. I. P.
[4], 34, [2] p.
Printed for Henry Overton in Popes-head Alley, London, : 1645.
"A member of the same church" = I.P., who has signed the work on page [3] and at end. The final leaf is blank. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug: 12th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

In both which, sweetnesse of spirit, and soundnesse of arguments have been endeavoured. Published according to order. I. P.
[4], 34, [2] p.
Printed for Henry Overton in Popes-head Alley, London, : 1645.
"A member of the same church" = I.P., who has signed the work on page [3] and at end. The final leaf is blank. Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aug: 12th". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Henry Overton
Popes-head Alley
